turns.text: Well Brent Ive been um I kind of gave up my career about three years ago to stay home with my children because I thought uh if it its only going to be another year until the youngest is in school
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And I thought it was good sacrifice to make
turns.label: sd

turns.text: because um it was important to me to to spend some time with kids I know that when I was in school and getting my degree at the same time my husband was it was really hard on our family because I would he would come home and I would leave

and then when I would come home and he would leave and um so I think one day one of our kids said you know - someone came home and they said well when is dad leaving or something It was like that they thought thats the way life was
turns.label: sd

turns.text: that you didnt have two parents at home at the same time And so I think um its become real important to me that we try to spend time together as family So theres one or two nights week we have - on Monday nights we set aside time where its called uh family home evening and we stay home that evening all of us and we do things together
Yeah I know what family home evenings all about
turns.label: b

turns.text: So you do that and right and then we try to do family activity on Saturday
turns.label: bf

turns.text: Right and then the family home evening too
turns.label: aa

turns.text: Right and then you know sometimes we try to do our lesson on Sunday night and then our activity or something on Monday but
turns.label: na

turns.text: Were its real important to us to spend time together
Well thats good Um how many children do you have
turns.label: ba

turns.text: I have girl and boy and the boys five hes in kindergarten and the girl is four Shell be in kindergarten next year
turns.label: sd

turns.text: My oldest is uh four and my youngest is about to turn three
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yes Weve my uh well when we first got married my wife worked for year Then we decided to have kids
turns.label: aa

turns.text: And uh she she got pregnant and then we decided she would stay home with the kids We would make that sacrifice It is financial sacrifice to make because we go from two incomes down to one
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And uh we made that decision and uh so sh- after she had the first baby she stayed home And and we had second baby and shes still at home
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And so uh you know at work lot of people are you know - I think well this is not normal situation anymore in our in our world we live in Most of them uh continue to work if they have have kids
turns.label: sd

turns.text: I only have one other person I know in my in my group here that works where the wife stays home and thats because of religious values as well Theyre Baptists and they and they think thats important
turns.label: sd

turns.text: But everybody else works and they drop their kids off at day-care and and leave them and I dont know I just dont want I just dont want strangers raising my children
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Well no and its its just not um its not as stable for the kids
turns.label: aa

turns.text: and they everybody decided to come over and talk to me right now But uh its yeah -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Thats how it is at our house when youre on the phone Oh its open anything goes when moms on the phone
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Well its also important I think um for my husband I I try to go out of my way to to plan things that he can do with the kids because
turns.label: sd

turns.text: since I am home with them and so I get lot of time with them he needs to have um some time with them So he when he comes home he um you know its his job at night He puts the kids to bed
and he spends about an hour doing that and thats thats pretty good quality time
turns.label: sd

turns.text: with them and um but its hard for him on Saturdays He he wants
With all the yard work and things like that

thats what he wants to do

Right we feel that you know just spending time together - You dont necessarily have to be doing anything you know that costs money or or you know that requires you to go great distance or anything like that Its just the kids like to being together as family
turns.label: b

turns.text: Like last Saturday we went had some errands to run and so we took the kids and and went by the Farmers Market down in in down there in Garland
turns.label: sd

turns.text: And they had blast running around the Farmers Market looking at all the you know the food and tasting all the free samples they were giving out And they had little pen there with animals in they could pet you know
turns.label: sd

turns.text: and they liked that And then on the way home we drove by the local high school and there happened to be an Future Far- Future Farmers of America --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: -- going on there and they had all kinds of pigs and horses and goats and sheep and everything you know all out in this in the in this schoolyard there So we just said hey lets stop and --

-- and the kids got to go around and you know see pigs and animals and things like that and and for them thats wonderful you know They they thought it was the greatest fun you know and it didnt cost any money And uh you dont have quite as much money when when the wife doesnt work
Well thats right But I do think um you know like the current trends are that um the family unit is devaluated Its not --
turns.label: aa

turns.text: -- nearly as important We find that you know back just even fifty years ago when people had financial problems the first place they went to was their family
And families took care of themselves and um but now you know people dont they dont --

And its not an easy sacrifice for person to make

too and it is hard to make uh those interests not be as major part of my life

turns.label: sd
